meanings.definition: Excessive adherence to law or formula.
meanings.sent1: His legalism made him follow every rule to the letter.
meanings.sent2: The company's legalism led to strict policies for all employees.
meanings.sent3: The legalism of always wearing matching socks became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her legalism in following recipes precisely resulted in delicious meals every time.
meanings.sent5: The legalism of checking the door three times before leaving became a comforting ritual for him.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that salvation is gained through good works.
meanings.sent1: Their belief in legalism meant they focused on doing good deeds to earn their place in heaven.
meanings.sent2: Legalism teaches that one must perform acts of kindness to achieve salvation.
meanings.sent3: The legalism of volunteering at the animal shelter every weekend brought joy to her heart.
meanings.sent4: In the legalism of charity work, they found fulfillment and purpose.
meanings.sent5: The legalism of helping others became a way of life for him.

meanings.definition: Strict adherence to the law, especially the letter rather than the spirit.
meanings.sent1: The legalism of following speed limits to the exact number frustrated some drivers.
meanings.sent2: In their legalism, they never missed a deadline, no matter the circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The legalism of always using turn signals even in an empty parking lot amused her friends.
meanings.sent4: His legalism in punctuality made him the first one at every meeting.
meanings.sent5: The legalism of reading every contract word for word saved him from many pitfalls.
